description: From Middle English porche, from Old French, from Latin porticus (“portico”). Doublet of portico.

entries.meaning: (architecture) A covered entrance to a building, whether taken from the interior, and forming a sort of vestibule within the main wall, or projecting without and with a separate roof. A porch often has chair(s), table(s) and swings.
The platform outside the external hatch of a spacecraft.
examples: By the time he had put on the backpack, McDivitt was ready to let him do more—to stand on the porch at least.
